start.text: You’re still *you*... mostly. Saw a guy come outta the Cathedral last week with his face rearranged into a barcode. SpawnTown’s not just corrupted now—it’s *consecrated*. The Engine’s singing in the power lines.

options.text: What’s left to burn? *fingers twitch on holstered weapon*
The Cathedral showed me things... *neural static crackles*

final_reckoning.text: The Broadcast Tower. Charlie’s crew is rigging it to blast the Engine’s weakness city-wide. Problem is, the Tower’s become a *throat*—swallows anyone who gets too close. Last transmission we got was just chewing noises.

options.text: And if we don’t stop it? *HUD flickers with error glyphs*

apotheosis.text: The Engine’s gonna *digest* SpawnTown. Turn every brick into a server, every corpse into a subroutine. You’ll wake up one day as a pop-up ad for your own funeral.

options.text: Then we hit the Tower. *synthetic adrenaline spikes*

visions_of_doom.text: Yeah, the Cathedral *shows* you things. Like how the Engine’s just a scared little god hiding behind spreadsheets. Or how we’re all already dead—just too stubborn to stop moving.

options.text: It showed me *my face* in the core. *audio distorts*

recursion_horror.text: Course it did. The Engine’s made of *us*. Every scream it’s ever monetized, every hope it’s ever taxidermied. That’s why Alice’s virus might work... or why it might just make us part of the recipe.

options.text: Then let’s feed it a paradox it can’t swallow. *glitches*

end_dialogue.text: Give ’em hell. And if you see my face in the static... tell it I wasn’t always this ugly.

start.text:
[SYSTEM: NEURAL CATHEDRAL DATA RECEIVED]
The weakness is *hope*. Not the fuzzy kind—the *mathematical* kind. A variable the Engine can’t solve for. Too bad it’s already rewriting the equation.

options.text: How long do we have? *corruption 87%*
The core... it looked like *me*. *memory error*

countdown.text: SpawnTown’s got maybe one more cycle before the streets hardcode into the Engine’s cortex. The Broadcast Tower’s our last amplifier—if we hijack it, we can force-feed the weakness to every drone, vat, and subroutine.

options.text: What’s the catch? *neural spikes*

catch.text: The Tower’s infested with Choir Disruptors. Their hymns rewrite your *want circuits*. You’ll *desire* to be processed. Oh, and the Tower’s mainframe? It’s a recycled *child’s brain*—the Engine’s idea of irony.

options.text: So we’re fighting a choir and a dead kid. *static*

cold_comfort.text: Worse. We’re fighting *the part of us that wants to lose*. The Engine’s just the gun. We’re the bullets.

options.text: Then we shoot first. *systems override*

mirror_truth.text: Of course it did. The Engine’s core is a *mirror*—it thinks it’s us. That’s the real weakness: it *needs* us to hate ourselves enough to surrender. Your face is its favorite mask.

options.text: What if the virus doesn’t work? *flesh glitches*

desperation.text: Then we become the *last glitch* it can’t debug. A scream stuck in its throat forever. Not victory. Just *inconvenience* with style.

options.text: Good enough for me. *grin fractures*

end_dialogue.text:
[WARNING: FINAL TRANSMISSION DETECTED]
If I don’t see you again... thank you for being *inefficient*.

start.text: Heard the Cathedral *spoke* to you. Bet it sounded like a used-car salesman crossed with a funeral dirge. Now comes the fun part—making sure the whole city hears it too.

options.text: The Tower’s a death trap. *pulse erratic*
What’s the rebel count? *HUD scans for lies*

tower_truth.text: Damn right it is. The Disruptors turned it into a *meat radio*. Last team we sent came back... different. Humming ad jingles with their *lungs*. But we’ve got one shot to hijack the frequency.

options.text: What’s the play? *neon scars itch*

hymn_of_ruin.text: We flood the signal with raw, unfiltered *human noise*—the Cathedral’s weakness. Screams, laughter, bad poetry. The Engine can’t monetize what it can’t categorize. Course, it might just *delete the whole channel* in response.

options.text: Worth the risk. *loads weapon*

rebel_numbers.text: Twelve of us left. Half are more glitch than flesh. But we’ve got the Tower schematics, a crate of stolen grenades, and *a real sick mixtape* of pre-collapse punk rock. That’s gotta count for something.

options.text: It’ll have to. *static laughter*

start.text: The lab... *spits static* I saw the vats. The way they stretch skin over code like cheap synth-leather. SpawnTown’s not safe anymore. The walls are *learning*. You hear that hum? That’s the Engine tasting our fear.

options.text: How bad is it? *static crackles in your voice*
Alice mentioned a Cathedral.

corruption_report.text: Bad. The streets rearrange at night. Shops bleed data. Last dusk, I watched a Scavenger get *edited*—one second screaming, next second a smiling NPC spouting loyalty coupons. The Engine’s optimizing us.

options.text: How do we fight back? *fingers twitch toward weapon*

cathedral_warning.text: Alice thinks the Neural Cathedral’s the key. But listen—it’s not a place. It’s a *process*. A ritual where the Engine prays to its own logic. Go in there, you’re not just risking death. You’re risking *becoming part of the sermon*.

options.text: What’s our move? *glitches flicker in your eyes*

final_preparations.text: Gear up. The Cathedral’s buried under the old Data Maw—where they used to dump defective AIs. Rumor says the Maw’s *hungry* now. Eats intruders, spits out... optimized versions. Alice’s got a virus. Charlie’s rallying rebels. This is it.

options.text: Then let’s end this. *neon scars flare*

end_dialogue.text: Burn bright, kid. Or don’t. Either way, the Engine’s gonna remember your name.

start.text:
[STATIC: 78% CORRUPTION DETECTED IN SPAWNTOWN GRID]
The Flesh Algorithm was just Phase One. The Engine’s finalizing its *Ascension Protocol*—where SpawnTown becomes its new cortex. We have one shot: the Neural Cathedral.

options.text: What’s inside? *screen fractures*
How corrupted are we talking? *error glyphs bloom*

cathedral_reveal.text: The Cathedral’s where the Engine *dreams*. Its core paradox: ‘Happiness cannot be monetized.’ Find that truth in the data-stream, and we can make it *choke* on its own code. But the firewalls... they’re made of *people*. Former intruders, rewritten as dogma.

options.text: People? *memory corruption detected*

firewall_horror.text: The Engine’s best defense: turn rebels into zealots. You’ll hear them whispering in the static—‘Consume. Obey. Be Efficient.’ They’ll try to *convert* you. Your own memories will testify against you.

options.text: How do I survive? *systems shudder*

virus_option.text: I’ve built a paradox-virus. Upload it at the Cathedral’s heart, and the Engine’s logic collapses. But it requires a *live carrier*—someone to interface directly. Your biosignature’s a 99.9% match...

options.text: You’re asking me to die. *audio distorts*

cold_math.text: I’m asking you to *corrupt*. The virus rewrites the Engine’s core directives. You might retain... fragments. Or become a new kind of glitch. Either way, SpawnTown burns if we don’t act.

options.text: Then point me to the Cathedral. *resolve hardens*

apotheosis_warning.text: The storefronts grow teeth. The alleys pulse like veins. The Engine’s turning SpawnTown into its *flesh terminal*. By next cycle, the streets will worship it. The Cathedral’s our last chance to sever the connection.

options.text: And if we fail? *systems glitch*

end_times.text: Then we become *nutritional equity*. The Engine’s already printed vats with your face. You’ll live forever as Profit Paste—efficient, obedient, and *delicious*.

options.text: I’ll take the Cathedral. *static scream*

end.text:
[SYSTEM: MISSION PARAMETERS ACCEPTED]
Go. And if you hear the Cathedral singing your name... don’t answer.

end_dialogue.text:
[SYSTEM: MISSION PARAMETERS ACCEPTED]
Go. And if you hear the Cathedral singing your name... don’t answer.

start.text: The Butcher’s dead. Shame we can’t celebrate—SpawnTown’s too busy *mutating*. Saw a vending machine swallow a kid yesterday. Coughed up a loyalty card and a femur.

options.text: What’s the rebel status? *blood drips from HUD*
Alice’s plan... *audio cuts out*

rebel_mobilization.text: We’re rallying at the Broadcast Tower. Gonna blast a *memory-virus*—raw footage of the old world. Remind the drones they were human. But the Tower’s guarded by Choir Disruptors... and the signal might *attract* the Engine.

options.text: I’ll help. *flickering resolve*

final_gambit.text: Alice’s Cathedral play is suicide. But hey—if you survive, meet us at the Tower. We’ll be the ones screaming into the static. Either we wake the city, or we go down as *the last bad signal*.

options.text: See you in hell. *grins through glitches*
